rules: Rule1: Whenever the EPA agency issues a violation notice to Company CO, Company CO fails a compliance check.
Rule2: Under the condition that the EPA agency conducts an inspection of Company CO, if Company CO then fails a compliance check, Company CO will face legal action.
Rule3: Either the EPA agency conducts an inspection of Company CO, or the EPA agency reviews documents from Company CO.
Rule4: Provided that the EPA agency reviews documents from Company CO, if Company CO fails a compliance check, then Company CO faces legal action.
Rule5: Provided that Company CO provides emission records data, Company CO achieves regulatory compliance.
Rule6: If Company CO hires an environmental lawyer, then Company CO appeals a decision.
Rule7: Company CO hires an environmental lawyer, or Company CO consults an expert.
Rule8: Under the condition that Company CO exceeds the carbon dioxide emission limit, either Company CO violates the EPA standard regulation, or Company CO achieves regulatory compliance.
Rule9: Company CO exceeds the carbon dioxide emission limit, or Company CO exceeds the methane emission limit.
Rule10: If Company CO consults an expert, then whenever Company CO submits a report to the EPA agency, Company CO provides emission records data.
Rule11: If Company CO implements a technology upgrade, then Company CO installs new equipment.
Rule12: Whenever Company CO implements a technology upgrade, Company CO purchases equipment.
Rule13: Provided that Company CO reduces emissions, Company CO achieves regulatory compliance.
Rule14: Whenever Company CO improves efficiency, Company CO reduces emissions.
Rule15: Provided that Company CO submits a compliance plan, either Company CO seeks an extension, or if Company CO installs new equipment, then Company CO improves efficiency.
Rule16: Company CO submits a compliance plan, or Company CO requests a meeting with the EPA agency.
Rule17: If Company CO requests a meeting with the EPA agency, then either Company CO seeks an extension, or if Company CO installs new equipment, then Company CO improves efficiency.
Rule18: Either Company CO operates legally, or Company CO achieves regulatory compliance.
Rule19: Under the condition that the EPA agency issues a shutdown order to Company CO, Company CO ceases operations.
Rule20: Either the EPA agency issues a shutdown order to Company CO, or the EPA agency issues a suspension notice to Company CO.
Rule21: If the EPA agency issues a suspension notice to Company CO, then it is not the case that Company CO operates legally.
Rule22: Provided that Company CO files a lawsuit against the EPA agency, Company CO seeks approval from the EPA agency.
Rule23: Company CO files a lawsuit against the EPA agency, or Company CO negotiates a settlement with the EPA agency.
Rule24: Under the condition that Company CO negotiates a settlement with the EPA agency, if Company CO ceases operations, then it is not the case that Company CO operates legally.
Rule25: Either Company CO accepts penalties, or if Company CO files a lawsuit against the EPA agency, then if Company CO ceases operations, it is not the case that Company CO operates legally.
Rule26: Company CO uses the scrubber system clean technology, or Company CO uses the catalytic converter clean technology.
Rule27: If Company CO provides evidence to the EPA agency, then Company CO submits test results.

Rule28: Under the condition that Company CO submits test results, if Company CO demonstrates compliance, then if it is not the case that if Company CO follows regulations, then either Company CO implements temporary measures, or if Company CO reduces production, then Company CO maintains production, then Company CO receives a subsidy.
Rule29: If Company CO cooperates with an investigation, then Company CO signs a consent decree.

Rule30: Under the condition that Company CO signs a consent decree, either Company CO admits a violation, or if the EPA agency issues a violation notice to Company CO, then Company CO faces legal action.
Rule31: Whenever Company CO pays penalties, Company CO faces legal action.

Rule32: Provided that Company CO uses the catalytic converter clean technology, if Company CO exceeds the methane emission limit, then either Company CO violates the EPA standard regulation, or Company CO achieves regulatory compliance.
Rule33: If Company CO passes an audit, then Company CO meets standards.
Rule34: Company CO passes an audit, or Company CO fails an audit.
Rule35: Under the condition that Company CO fails an audit, it is not the case that Company CO qualifies for incentives.
Rule36: Whenever Company CO upgrades its facility, Company CO reduces emissions.
Rule37: If Company CO purchases equipment, then Company CO upgrades its facility.

Rule38: Provided that Company CO requests a hearing, if it is not the case that if Company CO installs new equipment, then Company CO improves efficiency, then it is not the case that Company CO continues operations.
Rule39: Company CO requests a hearing, or Company CO files an appeal.

Rule40: If Company CO files an appeal, then if it is not the case that if Company CO installs new equipment, then Company CO improves efficiency, then it is not the case that Company CO continues operations.
Rule41: Under the condition that Company CO complies with an order, if the EPA agency issues a shutdown order to Company CO, then it is not the case that Company CO operates legally.
Rule42: Company CO develops a new plan, or Company CO revises procedures.

Rule43: Whenever the EPA agency monitors the emissions of Company CO, if Company CO exceeds the methane emission limit, then either Company CO violates the EPA standard regulation, or Company CO achieves regulatory compliance.
Rule44: Under the condition that Company CO revises procedures, if Company CO modifies its operations, then Company CO complies with an order.
Rule45: Company CO challenges a ruling, or if Company CO develops a new plan, then if Company CO modifies its operations, then Company CO complies with an order.
Rule46: Provided that Company CO closes a facility, it is not the case that Company CO operates legally.
Rule47: If Company CO halts production, then Company CO closes a facility.
Rule48: Under the condition that Company CO lays off workers, Company CO halts production.
Rule49: Company CO implements restructuring, or Company CO forms a new entity.
Rule50: Provided that Company CO forms a new entity, if Company CO ceases operations, then Company CO lays off workers.
Rule51: Under the condition that Company CO seeks approval from the EPA agency, Company CO submits an application.
Rule52: Whenever Company CO submits an application, if Company CO ceases operations, then it is not the case that Company CO operates legally.
Rule53: Provided that Company CO has an environmental permit, Company CO achieves regulatory compliance.
Rule54: Company CO has an environmental permit, or Company CO applies for a permit.
Rule55: If it is not the case that if Company CO installs new equipment, then Company CO improves efficiency, then Company CO continues operations.

Rule56: Under the condition that it is not the case that if Company CO follows regulations, then either Company CO implements temporary measures, or if Company CO reduces production, then Company CO maintains production, it is not the case that Company CO receives a subsidy.

Rule57: Provided that it is not the case that if Company CO uses the scrubber system clean technology, then if Company CO exceeds the methane emission limit, then either Company CO violates the EPA standard regulation, or Company CO achieves regulatory compliance, Company CO reduces production.
Rule58: If it is not the case that if Company CO uses the scrubber system clean technology, then the EPA agency monitors the emissions of Company CO, then the EPA agency issues a fine to Company CO.

Rule59: Under the condition that it is not the case that if Company CO implements restructuring, then if Company CO ceases operations, then Company CO lays off workers, Company CO declares bankruptcy.

Rule60: Provided that it is not the case that if Company CO implements restructuring, then if Company CO ceases operations, then Company CO lays off workers, it is not the case that Company CO declares bankruptcy.
Rule61: Whenever it is not the case that if Company CO applies for a permit, then Company CO achieves regulatory compliance, it is not the case that the EPA agency denies the permit for Company CO.

Rule62: Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if Company CO applies for a permit, then Company CO achieves regulatory compliance, then the EPA agency denies the permit for Company CO, the EPA agency issues a violation notice to Company CO.

Rule63: Under the condition that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if Company CO applies for a permit, then Company CO achieves regulatory compliance, then the EPA agency denies the permit for Company CO, it is not the case that Company CO faces legal action.

Rule64: Whenever it is not the case that if it is not the case that if it is not the case that if Company CO applies for a permit, then Company CO achieves regulatory compliance, then the EPA agency denies the permit for Company CO, then Company CO pays penalties, Company CO receives credit.

Rule65: Under the condition that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if it is not the case that if it is not the case that if Company CO applies for a permit, then Company CO achieves regulatory compliance, then the EPA agency denies the permit for Company CO, then Company CO pays penalties, then it is not the case that Company CO receives credit, Company CO qualifies for incentives.
facts: Fact1: Company CO submits a report to the EPA agency.
Fact2: Company CO implements a technology upgrade.
Fact5: Company CO provides evidence to the EPA agency.
Fact6: Company CO cooperates with an investigation.
Fact7: Company CO modifies its operations.
Fact8: It is not the case that Company CO violates the EPA standard regulation.
Fact9: Company CO does not appeal a decision.
Fact10: Company CO does not seek an extension.
Fact11: Company CO does not accept penalties.
Fact12: Company CO does not maintain production.
Fact13: Company CO does not implement temporary measures.
Fact14: Company CO does not admit a violation.
Fact15: Company CO does not meet standards.
Fact16: Company CO does not challenge a ruling.
Fact17: It is not the case that the EPA agency issues a fine to Company CO.
